topic.title: Initial Status: Circuit Breakers and Kirk Keys

body.p:
The two main input circuit breakers have mechanical interlocks using Kirk Keys controlling access to the breakers and the Solenoid Key Release Unit (SKRU). There are three (3) locks () and two (2) keys. The starting breaker and lock settings for a transfer are as follows:
Active power source: circuit breaker = closed; Kirk Key lock = unlocked; key in lock.
Inactive power source: circuit breaker = open; Kirk Key lock = locked; no key in lock.
Solenoid Key Release Unit (SKRU): Kirk Key lock = locked; key in lock.
SKRU key is released by a “permissive signal” to the SKRU Both power sources must be synchronized to perform the transfer. PDU Internal Panel, Kirk Keys
